heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 16 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.9°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 194 m) and light levels (up 4224 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10659 lux), cloud levels (up 1291 m), and feels like temperature (down 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 194.0m lower than yesterday, 687.5m lower than the past week, 1291.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 689m to a maximum of 1098m, averaging 675.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1362.7m and 1966.2m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, very clammy and humid and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and light levels will be low during the day. Weather could become unsettled.
